member.name: T:Griffin.WebServer.ModelBinders.ArrayModelBinder
member.summary: Can convert simple and complex arrays to view models

remarks.para: complex arrays mean that the actual type is a view model. Those models must an zero based indexer to be populated
Simple arrays consistes of a single dimension and being primitive. These do not need an index

member.example:
Simple array:
int[] ages
would be populated by:
<input type="Age[]" value="10" /> <input type="Age[]" value="8" /> <input type="Age[]" value="32" />
Complex example: User[] user would be populated by:
<input type="User[0].FirstName" value="Arne" /> <input type="User[0].Age" value="32" /> <input type="User[1].FirstName" value="Bertial" /> <input type="User[1].Age" value="4" />
The index is important so that we can map the correct grouped files together.

member.name: T:Griffin.WebServer.ModelBinders.DictionaryModelBinder
member.summary: Bind dictionaries.

remarks.para: The key must be of string type.

Used to find arrays which string indexes (like "Users[jonas].FirstName"). You can also bind arrays with string indexes by using single quotes around them like "Users['1'].FirstName". Useful if you want to map using Ids and not array indices.

member.example:
You can use string keys:
<input type="User['USR0111'].FirstName" value="Arne" /> <input type="User[USR0111].Age" value="32" /> <input type="User[USR37].FirstName" value="Bertial" /> <input type="User[USR37].Age" value="4" />
Or numbers:
<input type="User['111'].FirstName" value="Arne" /> <input type="User['111'].Age" value="32" /> <input type="User['37'].FirstName" value="Bertial" /> <input type="User['37'].Age" value="4" />
